subject: Re: Naming Test classes, was:Re: [junit] Test Variants
msgSnippet: I understand completely. Thanks for the explanation. As always, be practical. If you find that a third and a fourth test use only one of the accounts in the
messageBody:
I understand completely. Thanks for the explanation.

As always, be practical. If you find that a third and a fourth test use
only one of the accounts in the fixture, then consider moving them to a
separate class with a simpler fixture; otherwise, I wouldn't worry too
much.

Remember: three strikes and you refactor; but not before...

JBR.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-05 at 20:23 Johannes Link wrote:

>From: "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
>> I missed something. What's wrong with "AccountTransferTest"? Is
there
>> already a class called "AccountTransfer"? If there is, then perhaps
the
>> class is misnamed.
>
>No, there's no such class (maybe the design is calling for one?).
>My point is that if I put all transfer related test cases into that
class,
>most of them use the two accounts of the fixture but one test case
uses
>only
>one account. If I put that test back into AccountTest than the name
>AccountTransferTest seems to be misleading since the class does not
hold
>all
>transfer related tests.
>
>Well, I guess I'm putting way too much stress onto a minor problem. I
just
>love to be consistent...
>
>Johannes
>
